TopicTitle: Need some help with UV mapping

Articles.Content: Hey I was wondering if any one could take the time out of there lives to help me. so I have made a part before this one but this one for some reason wont work. once I import it into blender do all that and unwrapit then export. but when I try it in the game the texture does not appear and it sucks.
From your download, I didnt see a configuration file. Assuming you have the texture in a file called textures, and the name of the texture is in the config file, Im not sure

Like NIN3 said there isn't an configuration file.

Make one (see the documentation on part.cfg) and create map named textures in the folder where your model.dae is.

Put the texture in the textures folder and include the texture name including the file extension at the "texture =" line.

That should make the texture work otherwise you probably did something else wrong.
No called it texture.png and put that in the config but it was still not working

what format are you using? collada (.dae)?

Depending on format there is annoying thing you may need to do in blender.

1.Select all in 3d view

2.select all in uv editor

3.select the texture in uv editor. *you have to have all selected, use "A" key*

Some exporters treat the uv editor as uv assignement interface which is plain wrong..

Edited August 27, 2012 by vvaris
ok thx i will try this out
HA im so funny my problem was the folder was texture not textures im sill some times
